# accessibilityFrame()

**Instance Method**

Returns the accessibility element’s frame in screen coordinates.

## Declaration

```swift
func accessibilityFrame() -> NSRect
```

## Return Value

The element’s frame in screen coordinates.

## Discussion

This method is the getter for the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-c.protocol/accessibilityFrame] property. This method is called whenever accessibility clients request the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/Attribute/size] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-swift.struct/Attribute/position] attributes.



## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityIdentifier()**: Returns the accessibility element’s identity.
- **accessibilityParent()**: Returns the accessibility element’s parent in the accessibility hierarchy.
- **isAccessibilityFocused()**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the accessibility element has the keyboard focus.
